title: [Bug] RDP won't connect if certificate popup occurs
body:
### General

- [X] I have updated to the latest version of Nexterm.
- [X] My bug has not been reported yet.

### The Bug

Unable to connect to an RDP server that has popups for authentication for example.

RDP popup for 'The identity of the remote computer cannot be verified. Do you want to connect anyway?

So connecting to a server that has a self signed certificate that is not in the trusted authority.

### What device are you using to access the page?

In the browser

### Which operating system is your Nexterm instance running on?

Linux
author: bigwookie

comments.body:
Can't replicate.

I have multiple hosts that I connect to with RDP, all are self-signed certs.
Never had the popup  for _The identity of the remote computer cannot be verified. Do you want to connect anyway?_ with Nexterm.
It just connects.

When connecting from Windows to Windows with the MS RDP app, it _always_ displays the popup. This confirms that those certs are indeed untrusted, yet Nexterm doesn't warn and thankfully just connects.
OK this is not an issue with certs so closing this issue.

title: Added Google TOTP Support
body:
## üìã Description

Please include a summary of the changes and the related issue. Explain the problem that you are solving and provide the
necessary context.

The Problem was, that if you connect to a SSH-Server which has needs a Second-Authentication-Step with the keyboard-interactive Authentication-Method, the Connection will be closed with the Error "all Authentication Methods failed". To fix fix of this Problem is to improve the handling of the keyboard-interactive Event in the ssh2-package. So that the Server will receive the keyboard-interactive Event from the ssh2-npm-package, and if this asks after a Google-Authenticator-TOTP-Code, it sends a Message via the Websocket to the Client(The Frontend), that will prompt to the user to enter the TOTP-Code which will be sended after pressing enter back to the server.

If you have any questions or if i should change anything, feel free to write me. Also for any Improvements and Bugfixes i am happy to hear from you.

title: [Bug] Creating the first user account on a new instance with a single-character first name fails with an unclear error message
body:
### General

- [X] I have updated to the latest version of Nexterm.
- [X] My bug has not been reported yet.

### The Bug

When you're creating the first account on a new instance, if you use a single-character first name, the error will tell you that your username or password is invalid when you click to create the account. (Might also apply to last name, but I didn't test that as putting in my full first name immediately cleared the issue and created the account.)

This is a little confusing, as the actual fault doesn't lie in either the username or password, and should perhaps have a more clear error message.

Linux
